content.description: In the following statement, val1, val2, and result are Boolean variables.
content.question: Which of the following code segments produce the same result as the statement above for all possible values of val1 and val2 ? Select two answers.

choices.label: The figure presents two blocks of code that consist of 4 lines. The second block of code contains nested blocks of code. Line 1: [begin block] result ← false [end block] Line 2: [Begin block] IF [begin block] val1 [end block] [Begin block] Line 4: [Begin block] IF [begin block] NOT val2 [end block] [Begin block] Line 5: [begin block] result ← true [end block] [End block] [End block] [End block] [End block]

The figure presents three blocks of code that consist of 5 lines. The second and third blocks of code contain nested blocks of code. Line 1: [begin block] result ← false [end block] Line 2: [Begin block] IF [begin block] val1 [end block] [Begin block] Line 3: [begin block] result ← true [end block] [End block] [End block] Line 3: [Begin block] IF [begin block] NOT val2 [end block] [Begin block] Line 4: [begin block] result ← true [end block] [End block] [End block]

The figure presents one block of code that consist of 7 lines. The block of code contains nested blocks of code. Line 1: [Begin block] IF [begin block] val1 [end block] [Begin block] Line 2: [begin block] result ← true [end block] [End Block] Line 3: ELSE [Begin block] Line 4: [Begin block] IF [begin block] val2 [end block] [Begin block] Line 5: [begin block] result ← false [end block] [End block] Line 6: ELSE [Begin block] Line 7: [begin block] result ← true [end block] [End block] [End block] [End block] [End block]

The figure presents one block of code that consists of 7 lines. The block of code contains nested blocks of code. Line 1: [Begin block] IF [begin block] val1 [end block] [Begin block] Line 2: [Begin block] IF [begin block] val2 [end block] [Begin block] Line 3: [begin block] result ← false [end block] [End block] Line 4: ELSE [Begin block] Line 5: [begin block] result ← true [end block] [End block] [End block] [End block] Line 6: ELSE [Begin block] Line 7: [begin block] result ← false [end block] [End block] [End block]

content.answer: The figure presents two blocks of code that consist of 4 lines. The second block of code contains nested blocks of code. Line 1: [begin block] result ← false [end block] Line 2: [Begin block] IF [begin block] val1 [end block] [Begin block] Line 4: [Begin block] IF [begin block] NOT val2 [end block] [Begin block] Line 5: [begin block] result ← true [end block] [End block] [End block] [End block] [End block]
